edu.cnm.deepdive.security

Class Diceware

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.security.Diceware

  • public class Diceware
extends Object
    Diceware class constructs a random number generator using either consumer input or default methodology to assign a passphrase of specified length.
    Author:
    ryanlazo

        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if file does not exist.

        Throws:

      • generate

        public String[] generate(int length,
                         boolean duplicatesAllowed)
                  throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                         Diceware.InsufficientPoolException,
                         IllegalArgumentException
        Generates and returns ( in a String) a password of specified length. Duplicates are controlled by the duplicatesAllowed. If the specified length is greater than the number of words in the list and duplicates are not allowed, then you will get an infinite loop.
        Parameters:
        length - number of words to include in passphrase
        duplicatesAllowed - true if allowed;false if not
        Returns:
        words in passphrase.
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the source of randomness is not available.
        InsufficientPoolsException - if password length exceeds word list, and duplicates not allowed or word list has no words.
        IllegalArgumentException - if requested length isn't positive.
        Diceware.InsufficientPoolException

      • generate

        public String generate(int length,
                       String delimiter)
                throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                       Diceware.InsufficientPoolException,
                       IllegalArgumentException
        Generates and returns ( in a String) a password of specified length.This method invokes generate, specifying that duplicates are allowed.
        Parameters:
        length - number of words from specified password
        Returns:
        return true if duplicates are allowed otherwise return false.
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm is not available this exception will be displayed.
        InsufficientPoolsException - if word list has no words.
        IllegalArgumentException - if requested length is negative.
        Diceware.InsufficientPoolException
